txt.en: 'That was unexpected, to say the least! Have you been hurt?\n\n'We should leave here before more arrive. I do not know how many members this cult may have, and we are only two. Perhaps we can return later with more warriors to oust these cultists. For now, let us return to Iridír.'
Khûldim Umûn has led you into a salt mine where he claims the Dubarâkh is hidden. You should follow Girhâzi and Khûldim.
Khûldim Umûn has informed Girhâzi that the Dubarâkh is inside an abandoned salt mine. You have been invited to join them as they search the caves for the lost library of Ambarûli culture and history.

'Well this is it, [placeholder]. Hopefully, this pashâg is telling the truth, though I doubt it. We have no other clues to go on, so we must hold on to hope.\n\n'I do not like the idea of being trapped here with no escape. I will leave the Dumûri here to secure our exit. We can handle the Usan-kûni we will likely encounter in these caves.'

'That was unexpected, to say the least! Are you okay?\n\n'We should leave here before more arrive. I do not know how many members this cult may have, and we are only two. Perhaps we can return later with more warriors to oust these cultists. For now, let us return to Iridír.'
Khûldim Umûn has led you into a salt mine where he claims the Dubarâkh is hidden. You should talk to Girhâzi.
Khûldim Umûn has led you into a salt mine where he claims the Dubarâkh is hidden. You should follow Girhâzi and Khûldim.

TBD Khûldim Umûn has led you into a salt mine where he claims the Dubarâkh is hidden. Instead, you encountered Anâkhi cultists who he expected would help him. Instead, they killed him and attacked you, forcing you to defend yourselves. You should talk to Girhâzi.
'What is the meaning of this Khûldim Umûn?'
'You dare lead our enemies directly into our home, and then ask us to help you?'
'My good friend Húdak! Please help me!'
'Slay them and free me! They are your enemies!'
